markdown:
<title
    level="1"
    right="Armor 0"
    pfs="Standard"
>
[Explorer's Clothing](/Armor.aspx?ID=2)
</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Comfort" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=203" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

<row gap="medium">
**Price** 1 sp

**AC Bonus** +0

**Dex Cap** +5

**Check Penalty** —

**Speed Penalty** —
</row>

<row gap="medium">
**Strength** —

**Bulk** L

**Category** Unarmored

**Group** Cloth
</row>

</column>

---

Adventurers who don’t wear armor travel in durable clothing. Though it’s not armor and uses your unarmored defense proficiency, it still has a Dex Cap and can grant an item bonus to AC if etched with [potency runes](/Equipment.aspx?ID=278).

<title level="2">Armor Specialization Effects</title>

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Core Rulebook](/Sources.aspx?ID=1) pg. 275 <sup>4.0</sup></row>

Certain class features can grant you additional benefits with certain armors. This is called an armor specialization effect. The exact effect depends on which armor group your armor belongs to, as listed below. Only medium and heavy armors have armor specialization effects.

[Click here for the full rules on Armor Specialization Effects](/Rules.aspx?ID=211).

<document level="2" id="armor-group-5" />

<title level="2">Specific Magic Armor</title>
[Sarkorian God-Caller Garb](/Equipment.aspx?ID=1375)
name: Explorer's Clothing
